intro: Oreomyrrhis argentea, commonly known as silver root, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies. Oreomyrrhis argentea is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
